website_summaries.verdict: This small, yet mighty wireless access point provides solid coverage for large areas such as hotels or offices.
pros: Beamforming technology directs bandwidth where it is needed most

customer_reviews.title: runs on 24V, not 48V - Be Warned!
customer_reviews.text: This runs on 24V, not 48V as is standard for POE. It will not work with typical 48V switches/routers/etc. That being said, once I tried using the included 24V adapter, it worked fine. you need to download the software to configure and manage it, but after that it worked just as intended. I was able to set up a guest wifi separate from my private home wifi without issue. But again, it does not work at all with typical 48V equipment, you need to use the included POE injector. I was sort of bummed at that, but it's not a major issue.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Was blown away! made for ubiquiti?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to try with my ubiquiti AM-2G16-90 sector antenna, was surprised and had extreme laughter when the brackets snapped right in to the back of the sector antenna, and ubiquiti cover fits over top. Amazing, got -50db 100 yards in between 2 buildings. this is the first set up i've found that works at that distance for my wifi application, and its so pro looking. highly recommended for 2.4 ghz applications. peep my apartment window install haha! its not permanent i swear!
customer_reviews.author: Jared from IT

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, Simple & Works Excellent: I'd Buy it Again
customer_reviews.text: Excellent option for discretely creating an outdoor wireless access point. Painted it to color match our log cabin & blends in perfectly. Once installed, setup is quite simple when using a PC; it's possible to setup via mobile device (ie your cell phone) but more cumbersome than using a laptop or desktop. It also broadcasts quite some distance. I don't recall how far the product description states it broadcasts the wireless signal, but I still pickup it's signal w/2 signal strength bars 300' away thru the sense woods in front of our house. When in the open I still have 1-2 bars of signal strength ~ 550'-600' from the device.
customer_reviews.author: Match user

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing, Only Supports 100 MBPS Lan, Can't Support 300 MBPS Wireless
customer_reviews.text: The description of this item and also the box states this can support up to a 300 MBPS Wireless connection. I have a GBPS connection (which I realize I wasn't going to keep with this device, but I figured I would stay close to 300 MBPS). However, the lan port of this device only supports a 100 MBPS, with that being the case, there is no way for it to support a 300 MBPS. You can't make wireless faster then the lan supplying it. I had high hopes for this device, based on so many good reviews of it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Drains the battery on my phone!
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to set up, but then I noticed that the battery on my phone was draining in half the usual time. I found a good battery monitor app and confirmed that the battery current was doubled when using the EAP compared to my E4200. I contacted support and they were helpful for a while, but once I proved the problem to them they would no longer respond. They admitted that the EAP settings may be causing the problem , but won't help me with adjusting the settings. UPDATE: It turns out that support has been working on this, they just didn't tell me. I've raised my rating and we'll see if they can resolve the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Analog

customer_reviews.title: Works great for home
customer_reviews.text: We tried another product and we weren't pleased so we bought this one. So much better. We ran ethernet from our 1st floor living room, up into attic, and then mounted this to the ceiling in a closet of our 2nd floor. Went from having weak signal in our upstairs bedrooms (form our router), to have full signal from from this access point. Speeds are great. Coverage is great. We haven't used the app a ton but it works well. Can confirm that you can set the green light on or off, via the app. Install / mounting to ceiling was very simple.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Great range, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an Engenius ens202ext access point with this TP-Link N300. Installation is so much easier - just plug it in and type in its IP address to configure it. The Engenius product requires hard wiring it to a PC to configure it before installing it. Range is great - also better than the ens202ext. I have it connected to about 200 feet of CAT6 direct-bury cable and throughput is almost at the hard-wired router speed of 100 Mbps down. It's very sleek and if not for the LED (which you can disable) you wouldn't really even notice it .
customer_reviews.author: J. Stoltz

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!! Is my easiest description.  The WIFI signal rivals some business level.
customer_reviews.text: Just hooked it up yesterday. WOW!!! Is my easiest description. The WIFI signal rivals some business level. I could receive EXCELLENT signal all around the "outside" of my home from just this one AP, which outshined my actual TP-Link Archer Router it is attached to. Setup/management was relatively quick & easy for non-tech users. BEWARE HOWEVER... This AP signal is so strong, please ensure your AP 2.4 & 5ghz channels are truly isolated & differing from your actual wifi router/gateway so it doesn't overpower it but simply adds & complements it.
customer_reviews.author: Gray Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Puts WIFI Access Where Needed
customer_reviews.text: I am retired and do the IT work for my church. I have installed many wireless access points around our buildings. However, in my home our family room was on the fringes of our WIFI coverage. I was able to re-energize an abandoned Cat 5 cable to locate the TP Link EAP245 near the place where we use our tablets the most. It was the difference between night and day. We now have fast Internet service at our fingertips. I especially liked having the POE adapter packaged with the unit so I didn't have to purchase another item. It was very easy to install and is working very well. A low-cost alternative to a mesh network for the home.
customer_reviews.author: George Pfaffenberger

customer_reviews.title: Better than mesh routers...
customer_reviews.text: I tried using mesh routers as the means to have reliable WiFi throughout the house (it is not too large but there are multiple floors and has an odd floor plan). Not exactly a disaster but it was unreliable and mediocre performance. After trying multiple configurations, I opted to use Power Line Ethernet to route communications to the EAP245 locations in the basement. Placing the APs on a shelf and a bookcase, pointing up, solved all of the issues. There is now solid WiFi coverage on all bands throughout the house, garage, porches and, to a lesser extent, the back yard. These are solid devices, easy to configure and update, and they work!
customer_reviews.author: K R J

customer_reviews.title: Excellent access point at an exceptional price
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for almost a year now and let me tell you it’s the best Wi-Fi anything I’ve ever purchased. The reception is fantastic the speed is exceptional and I like the fact that I can mount it on the ceiling and just run one cat five cable that allows POE to be injected right into it. Nothing else compared to this so far that I have used and I have used a lot of routers and access points I definitely recommend this this does my whole house all three floors with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Guitano

customer_reviews.title: Works better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. POE injector included, making it really easy to install where there is no electrical access. Signal reaches far. I placed this in the back wall of my house. It covers the whole house and I can get good signal across the street, despite the obvious physical barriers and the numerous other WiFi signals from neighboring houses. Is able to regularly get 100Mbs transfers via iperf3 from multiple points in the house. It does tank a bit with multiple active devices, but is still faster than most residential internet connections in my area (20-30 Mbs). I'm not certian if it could cover your 3000+ sqft mini-mansions solo, but I figure with good placement, it's possible.
customer_reviews.author: Colin L Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Good performance and software
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to PoE feature you can place it wherever network cable can reach. Installation on the wall and ceiling is very easy with all hardware provided. 5Ghz signal strength is not uniform. Signal is weaker from the side with the green led. I get about 200Mbps through two drywall walls, 40ft away. With same device I get 400Mbps from 5ft away. Based on my testing I was getting better horizontal coverage when installed on the wall, not ceiling. There are no ventilation holes so I would be concerned installing it in unconditioned space.
customer_reviews.author: Ike

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, great range
customer_reviews.text: Integrating with other TP-LINK components for an easy to manage, secure network. Although I have another AP to put downstairs, this is managing 120Mbit or more all over our 4800 sqf, two storey home (except through the massive brick fireplace - which is excusable). Really impressed with the coverage. This replaced many attempts with other manufactures as well as with TP-LINKS own Deco mesch and Netgear Orbi's.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel B.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible range and super slow data throughput
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace/upgrade a much older outdoor wireless access point from TP-link. What a huge disappointment. This unit has a fraction of the range of the older unit, and the data throughput of this unit is absolutely terrible. Connected to an ISP router with 200 Mbps, data rate through this AP is generally less than 2 Mbps. The old unit delivered 20 to 50 Mbps. Nothing in the settings helped. This thing is just plain bad. The setup web page served up by this unit is very nice, and setup is breeze. But the range is poor and the data throughput is horrific. Amazon refunded my money, and this thing is headed to the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: G. MCBROOM

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Signal Distance
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AMAZING! I use it on a spread out wildland fire base in Alaska where we have multiple cabins in a wooded area. This provides WiFi to just about everyone. The distance is can throw a signal is impressive. I get near full signal several hundred feet away. I previously had a Netgear router set up as an access point, but it was unreliable and kept crashing/locking up. This provides consistent service and 2-3 times the range. I’m a very happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using an Omada for about 6 months now, no issues at all. I was having constant issues with my Ubiquiti WAP's slowing down and poor output/signal so I figured I'd try this one out. This one has signal all over the entire house at over 100mbps no issue at all without even slowing down. I'm in love with this WAP! I'm installing one at another house tomorrow so I'll see if it fixes the issues with their slow mesh network. Update: Went from a Google mesh router at the 2nd house at 80mbps, once I installed this product now I'm getting 335mbps. Huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: Robby M

customer_reviews.title: quick setup, great price w/POE injector
customer_reviews.text: Was very easy to setup. Just downloaded the app on my phone, plugged the injector into my switch, then plugged the access point into the port and I was up and running. Very easy to configure the SSID in the app (don't pick controller, pick the icon that looks like the access point). The 5ghz radio is much stronger than the ubiquity access point this replaced. Would definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph J. Calamita

customer_reviews.title: Yea WiFi upstairs!
customer_reviews.text: My home came prewired with CAT6 to a ceiling mount location and as my WIfI signal upstairs was atrocious I sprung for this device to alleviate my connectivity woes. I love that the included PoE injector eliminated the need for me to run A/C power over to the mount location. Installation and setup was painless and I'm getting about 1000 mbit instead of the roughly 100mbit I was getting trying to connect to the router a floor away.
customer_reviews.author: Topher White

customer_reviews.title: F$&@ing sweet
customer_reviews.text: These guys are bad@$$, I put a couple of these in my house and also purchased their outdoor counterpart which I have yet to install. The Omada controller is sweet af. WiFi has never been better in my household, previously I had frankentsteined a few router together but that was goitching our. Finally I bit the bullet and got a couple of these puppies on sale and holy $hiz are they fantastic. I’m a network engineer by trade so there was no real learning curve but tbh if you utilize the Omada controller these guys couldn’t be easier to set up, and my WiFi speed tests were maxing out the capabilities of all my devices.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley B.

customer_reviews.title: Better used as a speed bump to stop a steam roller!
customer_reviews.text: Junk, I bought it because it had good reviews. Now I do relay programming and build substation and I’m pretty savvy. This was by far and away the most frustrating piece of equipment I’ve ever used. When i finally got it hooked up the it was slower then dripping frozen honey on pancakes. I do not recommend this product in anyway. I solved my frustrations with this equipment by running it over with the tractor! After that I threw it in the fire pit to test the melting temperatures! It did very well on this test and passed with flying colors as expected!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just ok - Only 100 meg
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how they can say it'll do "up to 300 meg" when it only has a 10/100 NIC. I'm actually only getting about 35 meg so the NIC is irrelevant. The config is clunky to say the least. You have to install an app that only opens a web page. Why they don't just give you a link is beyond me. The interface seems to have lots of inapplicable areas. Like one BIOS fits all their APs. I use it in my back yard so I can stream my music while I work in the yard. It works for that. The speed and range are exaggerated.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bean

customer_reviews.title: Interface/setup issues
customer_reviews.text: I guess I'm slipping. I've installed a bunch of routers. etc., over the years (including the previous version of this mode), but the setup on this model is one of the most NON INTUITIVE, aggravating, excuses for a setup process I have used. Everything is set, but the unit WILL NOT broadcast an SSID. Emailing tech "support" has been a 100% waste of time so far. Their response is the model is a "business" unit so they can't help.
customer_reviews.author: amazonisownedbyamarxistazzhole

customer_reviews.title: Great coverage
customer_reviews.text: I live on 5 acres and most days have zero cell service at home. This AP nearly completely covers my ~1000'x200' lot. It's been great to be able to send texts, listen to Pandora, etc while outside. My only complaint is that it uses passive POE, as I would much rather be able to plug it into my existing POE switch.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install. Excellent signal.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a couple to cover 2 houses next to each other (one is 400 m2 but only 1 floor, the other one is 200 m2 but 3 floors). All floors are concrete and half of the walls also concrete, the rest is brick and mortar. Put 1 in each house and covered it all with 2.4ghz and everything but the top floor with 5ghz. Later I added a 3rd one to get 5ghz everywhere with no problem. Took me 5 minutes to add and extend the network. We can go now back and forth to any place in both houses with no problems in signal.
customer_reviews.author: Matias P.

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Device Works
customer_reviews.text: I want to give this 5 stars because it is working great. HOWEVER, the first device I received absolutely could not be configured per the instructions. I wasted several hours trying to get into the configuration menu. I finally gave up and requested a replacement. The replacement worked like it should and I had it up and running in 5 minutes. So basically I like the device but quality control needs improvement.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFTW

customer_reviews.title: Very nice access point, excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: I considered the similar spec Ubiquiti HD access point, but the TP Link was half the price but exactly the same specs on paper. I have been very pleased with the performance so far. I'm still using a Ubiquiti ER4, but I am able to get double the bandwidth out of this AP than I did with the Ubiquiti AC AP pro. I will be buying the TP Link APs for all my deployments until there's a better product and/or price on the market.
customer_reviews.author: C. Perry

customer_reviews.title: You can use it just like a WiFi router
customer_reviews.text: The Good: Don’t be Confused by the fact that this is called an access point, you can use it just like a regular Wi-Fi router. I plugged it in and mounted it and named the network and now I have an additional Wi-Fi network outside . The Bad: I wish the antennas were a little more versatile because if you mount it sideways like I did under the soffit of my house the antennas cannot both be turned 90° downwards as they interfere with each other. Other than that that seems like a pretty good product
customer_reviews.author: Basskitcase

customer_reviews.title: It just works.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to replace an aging router I had that couldn't handle the amount of wireless clients on the network. This ap fired right up and I was able to set it up using the Omada app on my phone. It delivers wayy better coverage then my previous ap and has zero issues handling all the devices connected to it (around 30) Along with that it supports vlan tagging which allows me to further segment my network as a security measure. All around a great product which I will be looking to order more for better coverage in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Random Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and quick install!
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up on a flag pole about 15 feet off ground. Had to supply wifi about 65ft away inside a big steel barn. Worked! Went from zero signal to full bars everywhere outside and around 3 bars inside the building. Steel is a pain to get wifi to unless a ap can be installed inside or you pay crazy money for a really powerful wifi ap for outside. Recommend for the technically challenged. Very easy to install. Download the app and it finds the app right away then set up as desired.
customer_reviews.author: Woodsy

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome but require a fair amount of knowledge to work with.
customer_reviews.text: First off, these are NOT a easy mesh system that are all the rage these days (think Orbi). These are Enterprise-grade Access Points. If you don't know what a wireless controller or POE is this system might not be for you. However, if you have a good understanding of wireless controllers and network switching these APs are great. I already had a VMWare home lab so running the Omada controller local was easy. Provisioning new APs is dead simple. Setting up a guest network was easy too. LOVE the band steering so that capable devices get bumped up to 5ghz band. I have two EAP245s and a EAP115. Wifi coverage throughout the house if amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Drucius

customer_reviews.title: Dead out of box?
customer_reviews.text: Tried using my existing POE switch to power it up, no link lights or signs of life. Used power adapter it came with and got a yellow link light. Unit seemed to be powered up with a green light on in the front. Tried logging in through the url on the back of the unit and no page could be found. Pulled up the DHCP server on my router and couldn't find the TP link access point. I believe its powering up but not talking at all. Will return and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Dario Albini

customer_reviews.title: Greatly increased range after replacing stock 3db antennas
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for omni-coverage of a 6.5 acre property. I wanted better extension phone coverage to answer or forward incoming calls on the main number and the DECT extension phones did not have that range, so I used this with a tablet and a SIP phone app. The tp-link was barely better than the DECT, so I replaced the stock 3db antennas with some 9db antennas ( and now all is good.
customer_reviews.author: Braath Waate

customer_reviews.title: Oh My!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a solid, consistent Access Point, look no further. Seriously, this access point is probably one of the best home networking purchases I’ve made on amazon EVER. Highly configurable and Wi-Fi signal is stable. I would recommend getting the EAP-245 model as it comes with an additional Ethernet port. Also, It does come with a PoE injector.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Rural Area allows me to STAY connected
customer_reviews.text: I do not get cell phone service ANYWHERE on my property (10+ acres). So to make phone calls I have to be within my wifi router range. I purchased this and attached it near a peak of my roof. BOOM! I can make phone calls all over my property! (well the areas I normally go, NO it DOESNT cover 10 acres) Super easy to setup and the cost for the value for me is pennies, id easily pay double.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Range is so-so.  Super easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these. One at home and one at a business. This AP took 3 minutes to set up after the install. Range seems about the same for both. With direct lien of sight, I get about 30 feet of reliable access. From 100 feet line of sight, it works, but drops or signal gets weak occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: moocowman

customer_reviews.title: Dawn obtrusive and very fast
customer_reviews.text: Took my chance on this product and I’m glad I did. This access point was extremely easy to set up an install. I gave technical support all the stars because the install was so easy and well written. It is a very low profile I have mine mounted on the ceiling. Does not look obvious. The signal it sends spoke 2.4 and 5 GHz and the speed physics dreamily well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Glover

customer_reviews.title: Works well.  Have to use the PoE injector
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this under an overhang in my backyard. The yard is 75wX100L and I get full signal everywhere, even in my shed. You HAVE to use the PoE injector. I have a 24port PoE managed switch and it wouldn't get power from it.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great home access points
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the EAP225V3. This one covers my whole house without any problem. Easy to install and get running. Easy to add SSIDs. I love that they are POE also. I bought a POE switch so I could add more in the future. I really only want to add one outside just to add better coverage when I'm outside.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to setup
customer_reviews.text: These access point 1750 are nearly impossible to setup. I first tried to set them up using the web interface, and that didn't work. I then tried to use the IOS app, which didn't work . I can’t access the setup for the device. And it was open Wi-Fi you can’t set password. Return.
customer_reviews.author: A.Ridha Mohammed Mirza Khoursheed

customer_reviews.title: Great routers, shame software is hot garbage
customer_reviews.text: The routers are fine. The controller software is worthless, at least under Linux. The series 4 of the controller software is completely broken, and Tp-Link has some of the worst technical support you will ever experience.
customer_reviews.author: Calebm

customer_reviews.title: Great product but use the IP address to setup!!
customer_reviews.text: Hello. I had difficulty setting this up. I followed the two ways listed in the manual but they didn't work. I watched a YouTube video and all they did was find the IP address by logging into the router and then entering that into the search bar. Super easy after that!! I didn't even have to mount it outside. I got full strength even when mounting it inside.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Galvin

customer_reviews.title: Works well at work, or at home.
customer_reviews.text: This device is working quite well in a simple home network setup. I didn't have to use a controller device/software. It operates in standalone mode just fine right out of one of my Ethernet wall sockets. The setup was simple enough. Signal strength/quality/bandwidth is way better than an average consumer grade device at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Y. C.

customer_reviews.title: AP Works/looks Great
customer_reviews.text: As the Net Tech for local Insurance agencies I often get called to install devices that are aesthetically pleasing and unnoticeable. This AP fits the bill perfectly. Once installed the Agent did not see the AP until I pointed it out and he noticed how neatly it blended in with the decor and the ceiling color. Range of signal is surprisingly far. While inside the conference room the other agents are still able to receive a strong signal in their offices and even outside. Furthest distance was about 100 ft thru 3 walls.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Complete garbage. Have to reset MULTIPLE times EVERY day. [UPDATED 2020/09/01]
customer_reviews.text: Got a 1500 square foot house that it almost covers, but EVERY day I have to reset it MULTIPLE times. 2020/09/01 Got a new firmware over the weekend and updated it. It works now, and appears to work well.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Great AP
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older Ubiquiti AP that needed an upgrade. Setup was simple and this single AP provides great coverage throughout my 2 story 3K s/ft home. No complaints from the wife or kids and the price was reasonable. Would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Bigddybn

customer_reviews.title: Solid access point, good signal strength, had to do factory reset before configuring it
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this as a standalone ceiling-mounted access point and I'm happy with the performance. Good signal level and has been stable. The only difficulty I ran into is that I had to do a factory reset in order to make the admin web interface accessible for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Miscellaneous

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install. Comes with everything you need. (Except for ethernet cables) You will be up and running in 5minutes. Excellent wifi coverage. Low profile. Great user interface. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Klmnooooo

customer_reviews.title: Huge upgrade to consumer access points, better than the more popular vendor
customer_reviews.text: Great upgrade to my Orbi. I tried a unifi NanoHD first and had issues with Apple devices, including homekit. This AP seems to have similar features so far, and I'm getting about 10% faster speeds on speedtest. Great find for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H.

customer_reviews.title: Pay for 400 meg speeds. Delivers 400 meg speeds
customer_reviews.text: I have a 400 meg plan and what i get hard wired is the same i get with this WAP. Highly recommended. Easy to set up. Works great up to 400 meg. Haven't tested anything past that so i cant comment.
customer_reviews.author: Randall W

customer_reviews.title: No signal
customer_reviews.text: I had assumed this could be plugged into a power outlet anywhere around the outside or in a garage and feed off a WiFi signal from within the house. I couldn’t get it to accomplish this. Only way I could get it to register a signal was to manually hook it up to my router inside which defeated the purpose, but even then the signal was weaker outside than my regular indoor WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: Lsu1000

customer_reviews.title: forget ubiquiti these are better
customer_reviews.text: i run cisco and ubiquiti products at work and i have started replacing all ubiquiti ...which have turned out to be garbage and works sometimes... with tp link EAP245 and controllers. great products with great free cloud management platform that makes it less complicated than ubiquiti tires to do.
customer_reviews.author: BEC

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: We use this outside in the back yard and it works great over the 100 ft range we have from the device. We use this a a "Stand Alone" setup which is one of the options, strong encryption with no problems. Great buy with a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Coleman

customer_reviews.title: great range
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical of how far this product would reach but to my surpruse i pick up 2 bars of wifi nearly 1000 feet from my house at my pond. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Wandrewmc

customer_reviews.title: Needs Professional Installation
customer_reviews.text: If you do not install these things for a living I strongly suggest buying another product. I deal with computers all the time. I have installed about 6 wireless extenders without issue but none of them were TP-Link products. TP-Link makes the best and easiest switch on the market but their extender and routers are a different story for the common retailer.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great and supports Guest Mode as an access point
customer_reviews.text: I needed to set up a guest mode on both bands and DID NOT want to change my router. This is one of the few access points that supports Guest Mode. It worked very well and setup was straight forward. Nice mounting options too!
customer_reviews.author: Ted de Castro

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Ive got 4 of these around my farm on Ethernet / fiber connections running the Omada controller in a mesh config and they work great. cheap and ez
customer_reviews.author: magneto

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Average to medium signal strength, gives about 40% of my original home bandwidth and speed. (40/40mbs ishh) Use it to provide internet access to a converted garage about 120 feet away from my home router
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Poor signal
customer_reviews.text: Dont waste your money on this AP the signal is lower than my previous wifi router an archer c8, what a waste
customer_reviews.author: Edgar

customer_reviews.title: Not standard POE
customer_reviews.text: Please note this will not work with standard POE switches, Its passive POE meaning it does not request POE like most devices. You must use their injector.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great AP
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 2 of these and have had great success with them. Good signal coverage and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable, will buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Some basic Wifi knowledge is needed, but I never touched mine since after day1. This unit is very stable and I do recommend it !
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great range.
customer_reviews.text: This access point has got great range. Outside line of sight is over 500'
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful access point. Installed in my house to use instead of router for clean install. PoE works great and overall it’s easy to setup and has a nice web interface.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Best WAP I've ever purchased.
customer_reviews.text: I'm an IT professional, so it was super easy for me, but I'm confident most computer literate people who can read and follow instructions won't have an issue setting it up.
customer_reviews.author: Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Extended Outdoor Reach!!
customer_reviews.text: Simple setup and expanded my outdoor network reach tremendously. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Huggmeister

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Good wifi signal to a previously inaccessible area. -70 db for over a hundred feet.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Excellent signal
customer_reviews.text: I have a two story home and this AP has totally transformed the wireless experience on the second floor. I already have a router/switch/DHCP setup so I'm using this strictly as a passive second access point; I don't use most of the functionality it's capable of. But for the improved signal alone it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Friedman

customer_reviews.title: Solved my issues with Smart Devices crowding my router
customer_reviews.text: This AP was extremely easy to setup and has solved my issue with all of my smart devices knocking out the internet on my ISP supplied router.
customer_reviews.author: Alien3D

customer_reviews.title: very impressive Ap
customer_reviews.text: liked this a lot, works very well. well though out design
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a Difference
customer_reviews.text: I must say, I was a bit skeptical when I first purchased this, but after setting it up I was absolutely amazed. I hooked it up just outside the back door at our main house and I have incredible service in the garage apt. Can run all computers, TV, stream like crazy. It really is a wonderful device and definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Texas

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation
customer_reviews.text: The ranch has been WiFi signal covered. It was installed on roof top. I think the cover range is shorter than the Page
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: You need to be a bit of a techy
customer_reviews.text: Not the easiest thing to setup but seems to work great.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Finally wifi to my RV!
customer_reviews.text: I used this and a 300 foot ethernet cable to get wifi all the way out to my RV on my property. Works so well I connect to it from inside my house. Very satisfied and easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work!
customer_reviews.text: Tried to extend WiFi coverage over the yard. Standing right next to this item and no improvement. 👎
customer_reviews.author: Richard Jansen

customer_reviews.title: WiFi signal is not the strongest out there
customer_reviews.text: setup is easy initially, but to access advanced configuration options you have to find the AP's IP address, something that's not intuitive for a lot of people. 2.4GHz is strong. 5GHz is on the weaker side.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Live on a 2 acre property. Placed this devise 15’ up in a tree. Get awesome coverage and it holds up in a storm; literally!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Frazier

customer_reviews.title: supper great unit. Best buy
customer_reviews.text: Great unit Wi-Fi everywhere in the house now living in my basement I have not disconnected from this Wi-Fi since I bought it
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Robust Wireless Access Point (WAP)
customer_reviews.text: 1. You must have a router that is assigning DHCP. Very robust WAP for the price. Multiple deployment options (Standalone, OC200 controller or Software Controller), POE+ injector supplied, Strong signal strength covered 4600sf, 3 level home with WAP on middle floor.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 2 months then... dead
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for 2 months. Now it’s dead, no Led lights.
customer_reviews.author: M.Speaks

customer_reviews.title: Love the POE
customer_reviews.text: I am using the versatility of the Power over Ethernet (POE) to place the access points where there are no outlets. I have put the main one between the joists under the living room floor. I gave a 'middle of the road' rating for Tech Support because I haven't needed to use it.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Sampson

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk. Has to be restarted atleast once a day . Randomly disconnects different devices . Taking this down and throwing it in the trash. Total waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Papa Mikes

customer_reviews.title: Great signal
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these around my office. The WiFi signal is spectacular, replacing 6 different WiFi access points. I love the fact that it is POE and I can run a single wire to each device. The management software allows for central configuration, and adding more devices is simple.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Great but
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, works great in router mode. There is no option for bridging.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Khawaja

customer_reviews.title: Great prosumer/smb wireless AP
customer_reviews.text: Great wireless AP. Consistently get very fast speeds. Paired with 4 total EAP245 my home network is great. I run the Omada controller software on an Ubuntu VM.
customer_reviews.author: Trifster

customer_reviews.title: There is a limit on how many you can purchase
customer_reviews.text: We needed several of these and the seller has a limit on how many you can purchase. We could only purchase one. We ended up purchasing the rest somewhere else. Great product but not when purchasing several for a project. I will buy elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: mark zeiset

customer_reviews.title: Good range, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this AP outside my house under the roof eve. So far it has great range and has worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Vince M

customer_reviews.title: Tp-Link AP units work great
customer_reviews.text: Good range. Allows you to setup multiple SSIDs and VLANs. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: EL

customer_reviews.title: Performance wise this thing is a complete turd
customer_reviews.text: Pro's Setup as a stand alone AP very simple Nice configuration options (VLAN's, guest isolation etc.) Software controller option Con's Cloud management requires a separate device Performance wise, this thing is a complete turd. I put a few 1440p security cameras on it and it completely choked; wifi so slow it was unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kuhlman

customer_reviews.title: extremely configurable yet easy to deploy
customer_reviews.text: easy to configure with multiple of these plus the oc200 as a super customizable mesh network
customer_reviews.author: AJ307

customer_reviews.title: 20 ft max
customer_reviews.text: This thing works fine as long as you are within 20 ft. Very little range. When I am outside, my indoor router connects before this thing connects.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: only for experts
customer_reviews.text: almost all the instructions a wrong. but, put in a good 4 hours and you have a fantastic system
customer_reviews.author: richard peters

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and works great
customer_reviews.text: Great AP and comes with POE adapter. Very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: MacAttack

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, great value for the money and works flawlessly
customer_reviews.author: James A.

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: I used POE and ran a Ethernet cable in the attic, worked first time, no issues. Awesome cause I didn’t have to add a power outlet in attic!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Brownstone

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and very fast!
customer_reviews.text: I just upgraded to 200 Mps Internet and my consumer grade AC 1750 router couldn’t handle it. Went with the Ubiquiti router X and a TP-Link EAP245 access point and I get full bandwidth. Easy to setup and got it going quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Ruscul60

customer_reviews.title: Very happy customer
customer_reviews.text: not many you tube videos available for advanced questions. However, with that being said, I connected two of these units using the Omada controller software. Software recognized both AP's and configuration was real easy. Two units completely cover my 4200 Sq ft office space. Very happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Garabedian

customer_reviews.title: A good outdoor access point at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: This unit works quite well at providing a strong wifi signal for some outdoor wireless security cameras. The POE capability simplifies the outdoor mounting. Happy with the unit and will purchase a second one for another application.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Schumann

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Easy and quick setup. Great signal. Excellent price. I always love my TP-Link products.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: EAP245 hands down the best Wi-Fi setup I’ve ever had.
customer_reviews.text: The EAP-245 devices mixed with the the OC200 controller is hands down the best Wi-Fi setup I’ve ever had. I’ve been running it for a few months now and in a 3700 sq ft house (with 4 APs) I don’t have a single location without full Wi-Fi signal. With the roaming function it’s completely seamless transition between each AP.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B.

product_meta.title: TP-Link Omada AC1750 Gigabit Ceiling Mount Wireless Access Point | MU-MIMO, Seamless Roaming & Beamforming | PoE Powered w/ PoE Injector included | Centralized Cloud Access & Free Omada app (EAP245)
product_meta.description: Model:AC1750Simultaneous 450Mbps on 2.4GHz and 1300Mbps on 5GHz totals 1750Mbps Wi-Fi speeds -supports seamless roaming so even video streams and Voice calls are unaffected as users move between locations -free cloud centralized management and omada app for ultra convenience and easy management -support power over -Ethernet.3at/802.3af) for convenient and affordable installation -secure guest network along with multiple authentication options (SMS/Facebook Wi-Fi/ -voucher, etc.) and abundant wireless Security technologies. -Band Steering automatically moves Dual-Band devices onto the wider 5GHz band for faster connections -load balance ensures large numbers of users have smooth network experiences in high-density business networks -supports management VLAN for an enhanced network management
feature_bullets: Business level access point, suitable for homes, hotels, warehouses, restraurants etc.
Simultaneous 450Mbps on 2.4GHz and 1300Mbps on 5GHz with MU-MIMO, beamforming, band Steering to deliver best performance
Compatibility with 802.3af and passive PoE support makes deployment effortless and flexible
Free EAP controller software lets administrators easily manage hundreds of EAPs
Captive portal provides a convenient method for guest authentication.Power Consumption:12.7 W
Supports management VLAN for an enhanced network management
